units.title: Culture organoids in 96-well format
units.text: 1 Culture organoids (or organoid co-cultures) in 50 µl of Matrigel and 200 µl of medium in a standard 96-well tissue culture plate.
units.rationale: This is a foundational procedural step that defines the initial culture setup for the TOBis MC protocol.

units.title: Label S phase cells with 127IdU
units.text: 2 Add 127IdU directly to culture medium to a final concentration of 25 µM (10 µl of 0.5 mM stock added to 200 µl of medium). Gently rotate the plate by hand five times for 10 s to mix the medium and incubate the plate for 25 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: This step specifies the exact concentration, volume, and incubation conditions for labeling proliferating cells, critical for downstream analysis.

units.title: Treat with protease and phosphatase inhibitors
units.text: 3 Add the protease inhibitor cocktail (100× stock; see Reagents) and PhosSTOP (40× stock; see Reagents) directly to culture medium, gently rotate the plate by hand five times for 10 s and incubate for 5 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: This step details the precise addition and incubation of inhibitors to preserve epitopes, a key procedural control.

units.title: Fix organoids in situ with PFA
units.text: 4 Remove culture medium by pipetting. Add 200 µl of prewarmed (37 °C) 4% (vol/vol) PFA into each well, taking care not to disrupt Matrigel. Incubate for 60 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: This step describes the critical in situ fixation protocol that preserves labile cell states and PTMs before dissociation.

units.title: Wash fixed organoids with PBS
units.text: 5 Remove PFA solution by pipetting, taking care not to disturb the Matrigel. Wash the cells with PBS on a rocker (speed set at ~45 rpm throughout the protocol) for 10 min at room temperature (~20 °C). Repeat the wash.
units.rationale: This washing procedure ensures removal of residual fixative, a necessary step before downstream staining.

units.title: Stain for live/dead discrimination with cisplatin
units.text: 6 Remove PBS by pipetting. Add 200 µl of 0.25 µM 194cisplatin/PBS solution to each well and incubate for 10–15 min on a rocker at room temperature.
units.rationale: This step defines the concentration, duration, and conditions for cisplatin staining to distinguish viable from dead cells.

units.title: Wash after cisplatin staining
units.text: 7 Remove the 194cisplatin solution by pipetting. Wash cells with PBS on a rocker for 10 min at room temperature. Repeat the wash.
units.rationale: This washing step is essential to remove unbound cisplatin and prevent overstaining artifacts.

units.title: Apply TOBis barcodes overnight
units.text: 8 Transfer 200 µl of pre-aliquoted TOBis barcodes to corresponding organoid samples in a 96-well plate (from Step 7). Any barcode combination can be used to stain any culture condition (Supplementary Tables 3 and 4). Incubate the cells overnight at 4 °C.
units.rationale: This step details the barcoding procedure critical for multiplexing multiple conditions in a single run.

units.title: Quench unbound TOBis barcodes with glutathione
units.text: 9 Remove the barcoding solutions by pipetting and wash the cells with 200 µl of 2 mM glutathione/CSB for 10 min on a rocker at room temperature. Repeat the wash twice.
units.rationale: This quenching step ensures accurate demultiplexing by eliminating unbound thiol-reactive barcodes.

units.title: Wash after TOBis quenching
units.text: 10 Wash the cells with 200 µl of PBS for 10 min on a rocker at room temperature. Repeat the wash.
units.rationale: This wash removes residual quenching agent and prepares cells for dissociation.
